description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国在1970年代初到1980年代初期的外交战略，旨在联合美国、日本、欧洲等国家形成国际反霸统一战线，共同对抗来自苏联的威胁。
description.en: A diplomatic strategy of the People's Republic of China from the early 1970s to the early 1980s, aimed at uniting with countries such as the United States, Japan, and Europe to form an international united front against hegemony to counter the threat from the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: 亚洲国家，在1970年代初至1980年代初实行“一条线、一大片”外交战略。
description.en: An Asian country that implemented the 'One Line, One Large Area' diplomatic strategy from the early 1970s to the early 1980s.

description.zh-cn: 时任中国共产党中央委员会主席，“一条线、一大片”外交战略的提出者。
description.en: Then-Chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, who proposed the 'One Line, One Large Area' diplomatic strategy.

description.zh-cn: 欧亚大陆的前共产主义国家。在1960年代中苏交恶后，被中国视为主要的安全威胁，是“一条线、一大片”战略的主要针对对象。
description.en: A former communist state in Eurasia. After the Sino-Soviet split in the 1960s, it was considered the primary security threat by China and was the main target of the 'One Line, One Large Area' strategy.

description.zh-cn: 北美洲国家。在“一条线、一大片”战略中，被中国视为联合对抗苏联威胁的重要伙伴。
description.en: A North American country. In the 'One Line, One Large Area' strategy, it was considered by China as an important partner in jointly countering the Soviet threat.

description.zh-cn: 指中华人民共和国与苏联自1960年代起关系持续恶化的状态，是“一条线、一大片”外交战略提出的直接背景。
description.en: Refers to the state of continuously deteriorating relations between the People's Republic of China and the Soviet Union since the 1960s, which served as the direct background for the proposal of the 'One Line, One Large Area' diplomatic strategy.

description.zh-cn: 1969年发生于中苏边境的武装冲突，加剧了两国间的紧张关系，促使中国寻求新的外交战略以应对苏联威胁。
description.en: An armed conflict on the Sino-Soviet border in 1969, which intensified tensions between the two countries and prompted China to seek a new diplomatic strategy to counter the Soviet threat.

description.zh-cn: 时任美国总统特使。1973年与毛泽东会面，毛泽东向其首次提出了“一条线”的外交战略。
description.en: Then-U.S. Presidential Envoy. He met with Mao Zedong in 1973, during which Mao first proposed the 'one line' diplomatic strategy to him.

description.zh-cn: 时任美国总统。其1972年的访华行程是中美关系正常化的重要一步。
description.en: Then-President of the United States. His 1972 visit to China was a significant step in the normalization of Sino-US relations.

description.zh-cn: 美国总统尼克松于1972年对中华人民共和国的访问。此事件标志着中美关系的缓和，为“一条线、一大片”战略的形成奠定了基础。
description.en: The visit of U.S. President Richard Nixon to the People's Republic of China in 1972. This event marked a thaw in Sino-US relations and laid the foundation for the formation of the 'One Line, One Large Area' strategy.

description.zh-cn: 时任日本外务大臣。1974年与毛泽东会面，毛泽东向其提出了“一大片”的外交构想。
description.en: Then-Minister for Foreign Affairs of Japan. He met with Mao Zedong in 1974, during which Mao proposed the 'one large area' diplomatic concept to him.

description.zh-cn: 亚洲国家，被“一条线、一大片”战略构想列为联合抗苏的对象之一。
description.en: An Asian country, listed as one of the targets for a united front against the Soviet Union in the 'One Line, One Large Area' strategic concept.

description.zh-cn: 亚洲国家，被毛泽东在阐述“一条线”战略时提及，作为联合抗苏的对象之一。
description.en: An Asian country, mentioned by Mao Zedong when explaining the 'one line' strategy as one of the targets for a united front against the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: 西亚国家，被毛泽东在阐述“一条线”战略时提及，作为联合抗苏的对象之一。
description.en: A West Asian country, mentioned by Mao Zedong when explaining the 'one line' strategy as one of the targets for a united front against the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: 西亚国家，被毛泽东在阐述“一条线”战略时提及，作为联合抗苏的对象之一。
description.en: A West Asian country, mentioned by Mao Zedong when explaining the 'one line' strategy as one of the targets for a united front against the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: 欧洲大陆，被“一条线、一大片”战略构想列为联合抗苏的对象之一。
description.en: The continent of Europe, listed as one of the targets for a united front against the Soviet Union in the 'One Line, One Large Area' strategic concept.

description.zh-cn: 发生在越南的战争。美国在此战争中陷入困境，是促使其调整对华政策的因素之一，为中美缓和关系创造了条件。
description.en: A war that took place in Vietnam. The United States became bogged down in this war, which was one of the factors prompting it to adjust its policy towards China, creating conditions for a Sino-US rapprochement.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党第十二次全国代表大会。在此次会议上，中共确立了新的“独立自主的和平外交政策”，标志着“一条线、一大片”战略的终结。
description.en: The 12th National Congress of the Communist Party of China. At this congress, the CPC established the new 'Independent Foreign Policy of Peace', marking the end of the 'One Line, One Large Area' strategy.

zh-cn: 独立自主的和平外交政策

description.zh-cn: 中国在1982年中共十二大后确立的新外交政策，取代了“一条线、一大片”战略。
description.en: The new foreign policy established by China after the 12th National Congress of the CPC in 1982, which replaced the 'One Line, One Large Area' strategy.

description.zh-cn: 由于中苏交恶和苏联的严重威胁，中国提出了“一条线、一大片”外交战略以应对。
description.en: Due to the Sino-Soviet split and the serious threat from the Soviet Union, China proposed the 'One Line, One Large Area' diplomatic strategy in response.

description.zh-cn: 1969年中苏爆发珍宝岛武装冲突，两国面临全面战争的威胁，这促使中国调整外交战略，最终形成了“一条线、一大片”战略。
description.en: The Zhenbao Island armed conflict between China and the Soviet Union in 1969 brought the two countries to the brink of all-out war, prompting China to adjust its diplomatic strategy, which eventually led to the formation of the 'One Line, One Large Area' strategy.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东在1973年向基辛格提出了“一条线”外交战略，并在1974年向大平正芳提出了“一大片”构想。
description.en: Mao Zedong proposed the 'one line' diplomatic strategy to Kissinger in 1973 and the 'one large area' concept to Masayoshi Ōhira in 1974.

description.zh-cn: 1973年，毛泽东会见时任美国总统特使基辛格，并向他提出了“一条线”的外交战略。
description.en: In 1973, Mao Zedong met with then-U.S. Presidential Envoy Henry Kissinger and proposed the 'one line' diplomatic strategy to him.

description.zh-cn: 1972年，毛泽东会见时任美国总统尼克松，此举是中美关系缓和的重要标志。
description.en: In 1972, Mao Zedong met with then-U.S. President Richard Nixon, a meeting that was an important symbol of the thaw in Sino-US relations.

description.zh-cn: 尼克松访华促成了中美关系的缓和，为中国实施“亲美反苏”的“一条线、一大片”战略创造了条件。
description.en: Nixon's visit to China led to a thaw in Sino-US relations, creating the conditions for China to implement the 'pro-US, anti-Soviet' 'One Line, One Large Area' strategy.

description.zh-cn: 1974年，毛泽东在北京会见时任日本外务大臣大平正芳，并提出了“一大片”的外交构想。
description.en: In 1974, Mao Zedong met with then-Japanese Foreign Minister Masayoshi Ōhira in Beijing and proposed the 'one large area' diplomatic concept.

description.zh-cn: 美国因深陷越南战争，开始重新评估其对华政策，这为中美关系缓和及“一条线、一大片”战略的形成创造了外部条件。
description.en: Bogged down in the Vietnam War, the United States began to re-evaluate its China policy, which created external conditions for a Sino-US rapprochement and the formation of the 'One Line, One Large Area' strategy.

description.zh-cn: 自1960年代中苏交恶后，中国将苏联视为主要威胁，并在“一条线、一大片”战略时期明确采取“反苏”政策。
description.en: Since the Sino-Soviet split in the 1960s, China viewed the Soviet Union as its primary threat and explicitly adopted an 'anti-Soviet' policy during the 'One Line, One Large Area' strategy period.

description.zh-cn: 在“一条线、一大片”战略指导下，中国的外交政策转变为“亲美”，与美国合作以共同对抗苏联。
description.en: Under the guidance of the 'One Line, One Large Area' strategy, China's foreign policy shifted to be 'pro-US,' cooperating with the United States to jointly counter the Soviet Union.

description.zh-cn: “一条线、一大片”战略指导了中国的外交，有效地遏制了苏联的威胁，并帮助中国摆脱了在国际上的孤立地位。
description.en: The 'One Line, One Large Area' strategy guided China's diplomacy, effectively containing the Soviet threat and helping China break free from its international isolation.

description.zh-cn: 1982年中共召开十二大，正式确立新的“独立自主的和平外交政策”，从而终结了“一条线、一大片”战略。
description.en: The 12th National Congress of the CPC in 1982 formally established the new 'Independent Foreign Policy of Peace,' thereby ending the 'One Line, One Large Area' strategy.
